title: How to Make Bacon Sushi

steps.headline: Boil the rice with the water in a large pot.
steps.description: Bring the rice to a boil, and then reduce the heat to a simmer for about 20 minutes while covered.

steps.headline: Uncover the rice and sprinkle over the vinegar, sugar, and salt.
steps.description: Stir well and fluff the rice with a fork.

steps.headline: Allow the rice to cool in a large bowl.
Prepare the jalapeño.
steps.description: Remove the stem, veins, and seeds from your jalapeño pepper. Slice it into strips using a cutting knife. Set aside.

steps.headline: Prepare the cucumber and avocado.
steps.description: Peel and seed the cucumber, and then slice it into strips with a cutting knife. Slice the avocado into small slices as well. Set aside.

steps.headline: Roll out the cream cheese into two long 'ropes'.
steps.description: The ropes should be long enough to spread on the seaweed sheets.

steps.headline: Cover a bamboo mat with plastic wrap.
steps.description: Cover it with a sheet of nori.

steps.headline: Spread the rice over the the seaweed sheet using a wooden spoon.
On the bottom of the sheet, arrange the fish, vegetables, bacon, and cream cheese.
steps.description: Repeat again with another seaweed sheet.

steps.headline: Roll the sushi into the shape of a 'log'.
Slice the sushi into pieces using a cutting knife.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the sushi on a serving plate. Sprinkle over the seeds and dump into the sauce if desired. Enjoy!

text: Boil the rice with the water in a large pot. Bring the rice to a boil, and then reduce the heat to a simmer for about 20 minutes while covered. Uncover the rice and sprinkle over the vinegar, sugar, and salt. Stir well and fluff the rice with a fork. Allow the rice to cool in a large bowl.  Prepare the jalapeño. Remove the stem, veins, and seeds from your jalapeño pepper. Slice it into strips using a cutting knife. Set aside. Prepare the cucumber and avocado. Peel and seed the cucumber, and then slice it into strips with a cutting knife. Slice the avocado into small slices as well. Set aside. Roll out the cream cheese into two long 'ropes'. The ropes should be long enough to spread on the seaweed sheets. Cover a bamboo mat with plastic wrap. Cover it with a sheet of nori. Spread the rice over the the seaweed sheet using a wooden spoon.  On the bottom of the sheet, arrange the fish, vegetables, bacon, and cream cheese. Repeat again with another seaweed sheet. Roll the sushi into the shape of a 'log'.  Slice the sushi into pieces using a cutting knife.  Serve. Place the sushi on a serving plate. Sprinkle over the seeds and dump into the sauce if desired. Enjoy!
